page.title: 17Roudham, near Bridgham
page.content:
There is little remaining of the former village of Roudham (lying about 1 mile to the north of Bridgham), but there are indications of its former importance: for example, there are 7 ways of approaching the hamlet, though today not all are accessible by vehicle - perhaps the most interesting is the Old Drove Road (for sheep) to the heathlands. A thatched barn, 50 yards long, now being refurbished, is the longest such structure in Norfolk. Whilst the church is a crumbling shell, it is still consecrated and used once a year.
The area made a contribution to both world wars, when army camps were constructed. Whilst the earlier camp has been returned to agriculture, the 2nd world war area now houses a small industrial estate, giving a few jobs.
